Description: Pottery ostracon: of reddish pottery, and inscribed on the interior surface. The inscription originally gave a short list of five Jewish names, four of which are complete.
Curator's comments: Published: J. Curtis and N. Tallis (eds.), Forgotten Empire: The World of Ancient Persia, London 2005, p. 199 [313]
Bibliographic references: Porten B & Yardeni A 1991a / Three Unpublished Aramaic Ostraca (pp.207-27, pls. 1-3)
Curtis & Tallis 2005 / Forgotten Empire: The world of Ancient Persia (cat. 313)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (91068) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/91068)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006 7 Mar-11 Jun, Barcelona, Fundacion La Caixa, 'L'imperi Oblidat' 2005-2006 Sept-Jan, London, BM, 'Forgotten Empire'
Acquisition notes: Acquired by William T. Ready on 19 December 1906 from the auction by Sotheby's of a collection formed by Robert de Rustafjaell.
